Engineering Excellence

Creating Innovative Metformin Products.

Metformin

What is Metformin?

Metformin is not a new drug; it has been used worldwide for over 50 years

There has been very little innovation with respect to such an important drug therapy. Low levels of bioavailability result in larger dosages and severe GI-side effects
The journal Clinical Diabetes reports that up to 75% of people who take Metformin report having chronic diarrhea and other GI-side effects
These side effects cause patients to unilaterally skip dosages, risking diabetic complications and costly emergency treatment
Learn more

About altanine

Altanine – a patient-centric treatment

Altanine increases efficiency and improves patient experience in Metformin treatment

  • Patient-friendly treatment
  • Special patented enteric coating for targeted release
  • Enhanced bioavailability of the medication
  • Improved body absorption
  • Reduced gastrointestinal side effects
  • Lowers the necessary dosage of Metformin

Products

Our products use a proprietary, patent-protected technology – that applies a special coating to Metformin.

The coating prevents the Metformin from being released in the stomach and instead causes it to be released in the small intestine.

Releasing Metformin in the small intestine not only avoids the typical side-effects associated with Metformin but also improves the bioavailability of the drug.

As a result, bioavailability using the proprietary coating is around 85%. This means that we need to use less Metformin to get the patient the same net amount.

Learn More Learn More Learn More

Innovating metformin delivery

Our patented enteric coating technology is transforming Metformin administration.

Enteric Coating Innovation

Our patented enteric coating is engineered to bypass the stomach, releasing medication directly in the intestines for maximum bioavailability.

Superior Absorption

Our technology ensures that medications are protected from stomach degradation, optimizing their therapeutic impact.

Our technology

Our advanced technology

Raw material is extracted, concentrated and processed to powder

key component 1

Microencapsulaion

Ensures targeted delivery and enhanced drug stability

key component 1

Enteric Coating

Significantly reduces gastrointestinal side effects and enhances bioavailability

Ready-to-use Medication

IP protections filed under
PCT/US2023/081775
*Altanine is considering new regulatory filings to broaden its sales, including orphan drug designation for Metformin in treating specific non-diabetic conditions, generic drug designation for Metformin gummies, and medical device designation for future Metformin-related applications.

Metformin License

Our Intellectual property

Altanine has an exclusive, worldwide license for the enteric coating for Metformin (including Metformin and Liraglutide combinations)

  • Metformin & Liraglutide are generic drugs previously approved by the US Food & Drug Administration (FDA)
  • Altanine can sell its products throughout the US using 503A and 503B compounding pharmacies to fill prescriptions
  • Regulatory & IP have been vetted by GreenbergTraurig
